channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was damaged on preload when it was being unloaded from the tailer. The package was then taken to the hazmat cage waiting to be inspected. there were four bottles one had been dented and the other one had the cap half on half off. DescribePack: one of the bottles had dented and the other one had a cap half on and half off. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: bay doors open and the fan are on along with the package was taken to the hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was processed prior to discovery of Damage, A Package handler noticed that the Container was leaking and Notified Admin Staff who then brought the damaged package to the damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: One can got punctured in the upper quarter of the body on the corner right below the Lid. the remainder appear to be undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a damaged hazmat tote and segregated from other packages to avoid additional damage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX IS WET, RIPPED/TORN ON ONE SIDE AND TOP CORNER. BOX ABSORBED LIQUID. INSIDE, 1 OF 4 BOTTLES HAS A LOOSE CAP THAT ALLOWED FOR LEAKAGE. ORIENTATION ARROWS NOT FOLLOWED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP TIGHTENED. ALL CONTENTS, MATERIALS AND PACKAGING PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND SEALED.

item.title: Report I-2023110011
item.description:
Report I-2023110011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: Dallas
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Aircraft was being boarded when passenger sitting in seat 16C noticed smoke coming from their fanny pack. They stood up but could not exit the aircraft because passengers were still boarding and isle way was congested. Passenger passed the fanny pack to other passengers until the fanny pack was thrown in the jetway and doused with water by a deadhead flight attendant. When smoking had ceased and device was cooled down, it was removed. Flight continued to board and departed. Photos upon request.

Package was bagged in a plastic bag to prevent further leakage on other materials. No leak was seen or noticed on aircraft.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PLASTIC PAIL WAS SEEN COMING DOWN CONVEYOR BELT ON ITS SIDE. WHITE STREAKS WERE NOTICED ON THE SIDE AND LIQUID INSIDE THE BUCKET IS WHITE. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, STREAKS WERE DRY BUT APPEARED TO HAVE COME DOWN FROM THE TOP. CLOSURE APPEARED SECURE AND NO ACTIVE LEAKAGE WAS OBSERVED. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: NO ACTIVE LEAKAGE WAS FOUND. BUCKET WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVED FROM LOAD SIDE AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report X-2023100942
item.description:
Report X-2023100942

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 0433. At approximately 0510 QA was called to unload managers desk by baydoor 12. QA was notified that HazMat package appeared to be leaking and that their was a strong smell emanating from package. Upon inspection it was found that one of the two items in the package had a loose top that allowed some of its inner contents to spill out. HazMat was placed in a salvage drum and moved to QA1 to process post sort. DescribePack: 2 items were found in the package. 1 was a gallon of paint and the other was a gallon of paint thinner. The lid on the can of paint thinner was loose and allowed some of its contents to spill out. Lower right corner of outer packaging appears to have a regangle shaped wet mark of about 3 x 5 inches. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA identified that the package was indeed a damaged HazMat the item was placed in a salvage drum, picked up from the unload and brought to QA1 to be processed post sort.

QA then appropriately handled the situation placing gloves on and putting the package in an already prepped hazmat damage tote. DescribePack: The package was open and wet due to the cap being completely off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placing the package in an already prepped hazmat damage tote

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (28) 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE 3M FIRE BLOCK FOAM FB-FOAM. TWO INNER BOXES MARKED LIMITED QUANTITY WITH (12) 12 OUNCE CANS IN EACH BOX AND (4) LOOSE 12 OUNCE CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2023110119
item.description:
Report E-2023110119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN3098 was punctured while in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3098-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101115
item.description:
Report X-2023101115

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was discovered at 9:20 pm on 5/1/23 while loading cap was not sealed properly causing liquid to spill, Ops manager Joey Galas then placed inside Hazmat cage placing container inside a drum to prevent odor to cause any damage. DescribePack: Loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was then taken to hazmat cage and placed inside a salvage drum to prevent odor from affecting employees.

item.title: Report X-2023100701
item.description:
Report X-2023100701

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T00:33:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ISP driver coded the package a 10 and left behind without notifying anyone. Upon inspection, it was found to be slightly damp, and one of the gallon containers looked about half full. DescribePack: After inspecting all the inner gallon containers, it was noticed that one of the caps was loose. No cracks or any other damage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was retaped.
